title: Fort Davis National Historic Site: Volunteer
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Volunteer            Volunteer       INTERPRETATION & VISITOR SERVICES  Interpretation: Duties include helping at the Visitor Center desk and/or being a living history interpreter/docent wearing reproduction 19th-century attire provided by the park. Required reading is mandatory for all visitor service positions. Library: Assisting with research projects, indexing microfilmed historical records, and cataloging books, photos, or maps. Resource Management: Duties include hiking nature trails, litter removal, and looking for signs of safety hazards or vandalism.  ADMINISTRATION  Clerical assistance: Typing, filing, copying, collating, stamping/stuffing envelopes, performing computer-related tasks.  CULTURAL RESOURCES  Curatorial Assistants: Activities involve working with park museum collection and assisting the curator.    To view more NPS volunteer opportunities, go to www.nps.gov/volunteer or www.volunteer.gov/gov
